intro: Boscia transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal boschia, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fissured bark and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers followed by edible, red, fleshy fruits that are an important food source for various animals. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
